name: Chisos Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: It is easy to give this hotel “a thumbs up” because it is really the only place to stay within Big Bend National Park. We have been hoping to go to Big Bend for some time and finally got there. It is one of the least visited National Parks and is well worth the long trip to get there. Give yourselves plenty of time – the roads are twisty and the pace is slow (and we didn’t take the time change into consideration). The room was nice with a lovely balcony with a gorgeous view of the Mountains. Deer came right up to the hotel and we saw lots of animals throughout the park. We did one meal out of the convenience store which was well stocked and not too pricey and we had an excellent burger at the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely, remote, awesome and well worth the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at chisos Lodge for 5 nights [4-8 march 2007] and enjoyed every minute. The accommodation is good; clean and comfortable. Fridge and microwave are very useful features of the accommodation but the restaurant serves excellent food at reasonable prices. The key virtue of the Lodge is its location in the centre of Big Bend NP. There are excellent local walks from the Lodge [no need to use the car] and it is well placed for driving out to important visitor sites - Rio Grande Village; Santa Elena Canyon etc. The immediate views [from restaurant or lodge rooms] are spectacular and look especially for sunset views over the 'window'.
reviews.title: The Chisos Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After calling for 4 months, one week before the date requested, we were able to reserve a motel-type room: we were overjoyed!
reviews.title: Motel with views
What a pleasant surprise!
reviews.text: The location is what it is all about -- gorgeous winding road to the lodge, magnificent scenery and easy, and most important, quick access to the park the previous and following days.

reviews.title: Wonderful Nature Place
reviews.text: The room was clean and very functional; tv was available to rent if you are so inclined. The heating worked wonderfully; bathroom clean and lots of hot water available. The rooms are non-smoking for which I am thankful: it allowed me to see a mountain lion slinking past while I was outside smoking =)

reviews.title: Very nice!
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet at the lodge was very good. We ventured out for dinner at the theatre in Terlingua ( excellent food and music).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A repeat visitor to the lodge this plain but solid property always does a good job. This is not a destination property but a great "headquarters" for your Park visit. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The restaurant, which is the only game in town seeing as the next closest is 35 miles away, provided a great dinners and breakfasts.
reviews.title: Good as always!

reviews.text: The hotel prides itself on being a "green" property and it does itself proud. The walk the walk when it comes to green practices.
reviews.title: Great location, needs updating

likes.disliked: — Needs a good scrubbing and updating

reviews.text: Stay here when you come to the park!
reviews.title: Coolest Spot in Texas in August
tasty food in a beautiful setting
reviews.text: First the problems, the linens were old recycled hospital linens. I suspect the towels were as well. The room needs to vacuumed desperately. Soap and shampoo are out of a dispenser. The bathroom was slightly bigger than an airplane lavatory. But the biggest problem was that it needs to be updated. The sinks, faucets, balconies, everything. Now for the best parts. The location was fanatastic. The park is so remote that this is the best hotel option at a reasonable price. The nearest other reasonable option starts at about $250/night for a family of four. Overall, I would recomend it reluctantly.

description: Known as the last frontier of Texas, Big Bend National Park encompasses over 800,000 acres of breathtaking desert landscape. Here you'll find the uniquely located Chisos Mountains Lodge, offering comfortable accommodations and friendly Texas hospitality.
